title: Osprey's Dominion 2014 Pinot Noir (North Fork of Long Island)
description: While concentrated black-cherry flavors shine brightly, this herbaceous wine suggests a leaner, more savory expression of Long Island Pinot Noir. Bright acidity and firm tannins maintain a taut, tight feel.

title: Navarro 2014 Deep End Blend Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is smoky and spicy in aroma, moderately sweet on the palate and nicely filled out with honey and peach flavors. A very good apéritif wine, it should pair well with spicy food.

title: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Grown Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This salmon-colored Malbec-driven rosé offers bright aromas of strawberry, melon and spice that are followed by juicy, dry, lightly styled flavors. The tart, citrusy finish gives it a snap.

title: Espiritu de Chile 2015 Winemaker's Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Clean, reserved citrus and ocean-influenced aromas set up a zesty palate with a common mix of tangerine, lime and green-herb flavors. A lasting finish with peppery snap helps this along.

title: Fjord 2014 Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)
description: Amidst layers of bramble, toast, cedar and herb, bright raspberry and blackberry flavors penetrate throughout this full-bodied Cab Franc. Equal parts fruity and savory, it suggests nuances of beet and soil without being earthy or vegetal. Sunny cranberry acidity and whispery tannins lend a soft, easy frame.

title: Porto Carras 2014 Malagousia (Sithonia)
description: Butterscotch, honey and spice aromas lead this white from Porto Carras. The wine has a slightly heavy feel with vanilla and spice overtones leasing. Overall though, a pretty wine with a serious character.

title: Proulx 2015 Willow Creek Farm Rose of Mission (Paso Robles)
description: This gets special attention because winemaker Kevin Riley is one of the few to engage with old vines of the historic Mission grape variety. Light watermelon, orange spritz and wet cement show on the nose, while the slightly watery palate offers red fruit, crushed rock and citrus rinds on the finish.

title: Frank Family 2012 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Honeycomb and a fruit basket of melon and berry ride a wave of medium acidity and mellowed sweetness, with a touch of green apple. This is a good call for morning Mimosas.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Alder Ridge Vineyard Rosé Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine is pale peach in color. It starts with aromas of strawberry, herb and spice that lead to juicy, just-off-dry, well-balanced fruit flavors that provide a whole lot of appeal.

title: McFadden NV Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Potter Valley)
description: Attractive and generously fruity, this offers flavors of apples and peaches and a mouthfilling mousse of bubbles. The texture is slightly soft but appetizing.

title: La Forge Estate 2015 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)
description: Oaky aromas of baked apple and toasted wood are upfront on the nose of this wine, but are grounded by ample ripe peach, apple flesh and orange. The medium-weight palate is lushly textured and slightly round in feel, though ample acidity helps to keep the flavors fresh and vibrant through the spicy finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2015 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Copper-orange-pink in color, this wonderfully summery wine offers tart citrus and gravelly minerality, a taste of wet stone coated in just the right amount of sweetness.

title: Nemeion Estate 2010 Agiorgitiko (Nemea)
description: Sweet cedar, cinnamon and plum aromas are followed by plush and pretty flavors of black cherry, raspberry and plum. The wine offers a good acid balance and a spicy, bright finish. This should pair well with tomato-based dishes and lamb.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: With the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard, the aromas offer notes of coffee, cocoa, smoke, vanilla and purple fruit. The flavors are elegant in style, with nubby tannins providing the frame.

title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Pacheca Colheita Red (Douro)
description: A ripe, bold and fruity wine, that is rounded and packed with black currant flavors. Its soft tannins are comfortably embedded in the rich fruitiness. Made from classic Douro grapes, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Tempus Cellars 2014 Evergreen Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)
description: Mineral, dried peach, lees and honeysuckle aromas lead to just off-dry flavors. Racy acidity frames it nicely.

title: Sheldrake Point 2015 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: A vein of burnt sugar threads curiously from nose to finish in this dry full-bodied Pinot Gris. Sunny tangerine, pineapple and apricot flavors flood the midpalate, brightened by streak of lime acidity. A graceful balance of brawn and restraint, it should drink well through 2021.

title: Vieil Armand 2014 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: Lemony freshness meets earthy, textured glints on this slender Riesling characterized by its brightness and slender body. Underneath it all, plenty of tart, refreshing apple fruit leads to a clean, lively finish.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Hints of smoke and bramble linger from nose to finish, lending a savory complexity to this dry-style Riesling. It's spry and invigorating, juxtaposing tart pineapple and lemon flavors against a backdrop of pressed apple and pear. The finish extends long with an elegant mineral tinge.

title: Viña el Aromo 2012 Private Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)
description: Earthy cherry and cassis aromas are backed by bacon and generic gritty scents. This Maule Malbec feels chunky, while salty plum and oaky flavors finish with notes of hickory, savory meat and controlled heat.

title: W. Gisselbrecht 2015 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Notes of freshly peeled red apples are inviting and continue on the soft, rounded and generous palate. It has a lovely midpalate mouthfeel and drinks just off dry, with an accent of vanilla and the merest touch of cinnamon.

title: Talbott 2012 R&V Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Late Harvest Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Deep golden-yellow in the glass, this wine offers honeyed, candied aromas of mango, crystallized vanilla and golden raisin. It's thick and unctuous on the palate, with more honey, spun sugar, honeysuckle and fruit-nectar flavors that are delicious, but would be aided by a boost of acidity.
designation: R&V Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Late Harvest

title: San Pedro 2015 1865 Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Elqui Valley)
description: Chunky aromas of peach and melon are briny and pickled. With high acidity maintaining shape, there's pinch to the palate. Typical Elqui Valley flavors of mustard and briny apple finish full, viscous and muscular, with a pickled citrus aftertaste.

title: Sand Point 2013 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Spicy, minty aromas and rich flavors like dark chocolate and black cherries add up to a bold, full-bodied wine from the Lange Twins. It has a deep color, moderate tannins to add grip to the texture and a lingering finish.

title: Sean Minor 2013 Nicole Marie Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 51% Merlot with 29% Zinfandel, 15% Petit Verdot and 5% Petite Sirah, combining nicely for a full-bodied expression of chocolate and dried dark cherry. On the palate, it becomes dusty and somewhat rustic, with an intensely juicy finish.

title: Wolfberger 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Soft notes of honeysuckle adorn mandarin and clementine fruit. The off-dry palate is richer than the nose suggests and its residual sweetness boosts the full-fruited, peachy nature of the wine. It finishes warm, but zesty and citrus-flavored.

title: Wölffer 2013 Fatalis Fatum Red (Long Island)
description: Black-cherry and currant flavors are concentrated but restrained in this full-bodied Bordeaux-style blend. Smoky, woody and a bit savory in style, it's abundantly oaky but should balance out neatly from 2020. Bold tannins and brisk acidity mark the finish.

title: Calcareous 2015 Lily Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of dried apple and hot toast show on the nose of this blend of 43% Grenache Blanc, 39% Roussanne and 18% Viognier. There is an intriguing tension to the palate, where bright Gala apple meets with persistent acidity, finishing on somewhat sour green apple and pear skins.

title: Caparzo 2014 Vigna La Caduta  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: Fragrant and polished, this single-vineyard Sangiovese opens with scents of fragrant purple flower, wild berry, dark spice and espresso. The medium-bodied palate offers juicy red berry, vanilla and a hint of toast alongside lithe tannins and bright acidity.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Trincadeira (Alentejano)
description: Grown on schist soil that gives this wine a mineral character. It is structured while also full of juicy acidity, red fruits and firm tannins. Wood aging has added an extra richness to this full, perfumed wine. Drink from 2017.
